title: Educational Course for Understanding Machine Learning Concepts Through Scientific Argumentation and Cognitive Apprenticeship

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Statistics and Programming Concepts (Introductory Python)
context.additional_context: Combines twice-weekly face-to-face sessions with online activities in a BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) environment, providing continuous feedback through formative assessments

learning_goals: Learners can explain fundamental principles of machine learning models (underfitting/fitting/overfitting) using a scientific argumentation framework.
Learners can implement neural network models on real datasets and justify results with textual/visual evidence.
Learners can complete the analysis-reflection-revision cycle required by the cognitive apprenticeship model through peer feedback at over 80% proficiency.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
